habitat_description: This species is found from western Washington and extreme northwestern Oregon (Nussbaum 1970; Leonard et al. 1998). The range extends from the Cascades Mountains south of Mt. Rainier, the Willapa Hills, and the Olympic Peninsula, and also from the vicinity of the Columbia River Gorge in northwestern Oregon (Green et al. 2013). Breeding habitat consists of chambers under rocks and logs, but also banks of streams (Nussbaum et al. 1983; Steele et al. 2003). As adults, Cope’s giant salamanders occupy mountain pools and streams where cover is provided by large stones (Bury et al. 1991).
